intro: Scopolia megapotamica, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are heart-shaped and slightly hairy, while its flowers range in color from white to purple. Scopolia megapotamica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
